recommendations.recommendation:
This is NOT the greatest anime ever made. Not one bit close. Really. Legend of Blah-Blah-Blah focuses about human relations, politics, military and their impacts on flow of history. While some episodes are done with rare talent, extraordinary depth and colour, the next one of endless 110 is so much retarded, u cant help asking yourself - is this sh*t for real? When they decided to make 110 episodes of Democracy, they should have made 110 GOOD episodes. It`s like one episode characters speak of noble value of single person`s rights, and the other one 10 pentazillions of soldiers die, and no one gives a flying f*ck. Not to mention cheesy tactics genius Yan, small packs of useless unimportant spartans, dumbest admirals of known universe and lame repetative space fights.
It`s 8 of 10. with all respect to the old age.
best space opera anime there is :)
Different from your everyday, run-of-the-mill anime, this is truly an epic story. It`s depth and incredibly large scope are astonishing, on par or even greater than Juuni Kokuki.

A Sweeping story expanding in cast and depth. As a century long war draws to a conclusion, the story centers on the many characters that bring about the end of one era while ushering in another. The complexities of politics, military leadership, and personal ambitions, combine with ideology and individual convictions on a grand scale. This series is about war and its costs as well as its benefit. One main character pontificates frequently about the waste of warfare and it futility, all the while proving that he is a master of the art. The other main character is a driven force. First he seeks to gain vengence against a ruling class before seeking to unify and revolutionize all that he has gained. There are several underlying arguements regarding totalitarianism versus democracy that constantly rock the characters and make them more human. In truth this anime is close to many historical references to the fall of one dynasty and the rise of another

Great plot, exceptional character design. I liked the commentary about war and politics, and how different point of views were colliding and merging together as the serie progressed. The historical facts that were given were also a nice addition in understanding how the rivaling states were created. Despite the high episode count, I still wished at the end that there were still more episodes to watch! Definetly a must see!

A really nice series, even if the animation is pretty old-fashioned ;)
The story is nice, as it shows intrigues, politics but also nice space-battles.
Funny thing: The German names of the Empire-People! Being German myself I can tell :D Also the "Original German Titel" "HeR(!)densagen vom Kosmsosinsel" is just soo funny as there`s no correct translation to THIS sentence ;D
Very funny ;D I enjoy this series eitherway :D
Great cast of characters, excellent plot
I rarely use word epic, but this deserves it.
Epic space opera. As others have said, real characters and strategic space battles.
Epic as epic can be - character development and plot continuity added to brilliant political and military tactics.
Space opera at it`s finest, must see.

The only downside to this anime is that it sets a standard that`s practically impossible to match. It`ll remain as the zenith of epic, multiple season-spanning series that involves intricate storyline for many years to come. Considering it already is 10 to 20 years old, its accomplishment is marvelous as it dwarfs brand new productions with its mature, serious and novelistic style. A must see for anyone who wants to watch a deep plot unfolding which is about politics, history and warfare.

The only bad thing about this anime is that it`s so good, it makes other anime series look bad. The best and most intelligent plot in any anime, and believable characters. Don`t let the relatively old age drive you off. While the visuals are old, they`re far better than most newer series.

Coming from a long line of trekkies, I never thought I`d have another sci-fi series so easily surpass my expectations like this. LoGH is by far the best sci-fi series I have watched, read, or otherwise experienced. It is a lot more focused on the political side of science fiction than most in the genre, but I can only commend Dr. Tanaka and the others who worked on this for pulling it off so masterfully.
For the love of everything that is good in this world, [b]Watch this show[/b], you`re only doing yourself a disservice otherwise.

A truly brilliant show and a must see if you`re interested in politically themed anime. The old-school animation and sheer number of episodes may seem off-putting to some, but if you want a rich, well developed story full of realistic characters and situations to sink your teeth into then you couldn`t do much better than this. My only possible complaints would be that there were so many characters (many of whom look quite similar) that I found it hard to keep track of all of them, and the current translations leave a little to be desired... but don`t let that put you off watching this classic masterpiece!

The [b]greatest anime ever created[/b], a [b]true classic[/b], a [b]masterpiece beyond words[/b]. [i]Epic plot, awesome cast and the most important of all, it`s damn realistic. The characters act the way humans would.[/i] Also to everyone crying about bad animation, the BDrips have been released and are pretty decent visually. [b]MUST WATCH IF YOU`RE LOOKING FOR A SERIOUS STORY.[/b]
Perfect epic.
The greatest anime ever created Just pick it up and watch and you will say the same thing as I.

Objectively best anime existing. Good characters, good plot, nothing extra and very cohesive.
For mature audience, with deep political and historical themes.

The one anime closest to perfection. The detail and scope that is present in Legend of the Galactic Heroes is enough to make you shake your head in disbelief.
A huge cast with no overtly edged personality types, perfect dialogue, classic music and tons of scheming, power play makes certain that the pace will never drop for the entirety of its 110 episodes duration.
one of the best retro anime ever produced epic storyline for a seinen anime shounen lovers look otherwise
This is greatest anime ever made. There are 162 episodes (main series and OVAs) and 3 movies with over 6000 named characters. And 2017 there is going to be a remake. I can`t wait.

I wanted to do a proper recommendation but find myself at a loss for words after watching the last episode. To put it simply: Legend of the Galactic Heroes is, without doubt, one of the finest achievements in anime history.
Brain fodder.
best space opera ever

A true classic beyond words and probably one of the most dialog driven anime ever.But it`s successful in technical aspects too.Unforgettable characters,very deep social and political commentaries,great space battles and intense drama makes this old(yet wise) pal a must see before dying.

Words just can`t describe how epic and all-encompassing this anime is. Impeccably retains an air of gravitas to the very end and beyond. A compelling galactic history, with agonising missed opportunities, plans within plans and actions that play themselves out in epic fashion without ever needing to resort to cheap sensationalism and cowardly cop-outs.

Best Space opera series ever. The character development its just amazing and plot is out of this world. Focuses a lot on realistic military strategy during the epic fleet battles as well. A true masterpiece.
Quite simply; Greatness.
Probably the best space opera out there.

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr991 [Tanaka Yoshiki]`s series of science fiction novels by the same name. It is late into the 36th century in the ancient Christian calendar; mankind, having developed the technology to travel faster than light speed and colonize many planets, has taken a hold of space, to the point of abandoning Earth almost entirely. Two superpowers comprising almost all the human population have now for one and a half centuries waged to a long stalemate a war for interstellar supremacy: the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire] and the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance]. When he was young and poor, http://anidb.net/ch186 [Count Reinhard von Lohengramm], a military genius born a noble in name only, saw his sister, http://anidb.net/ch205 [Countess Annerose von Grunewald], turned into an Imperial concubine; having once helplessly watched her being practically sold to http://anidb.net/ch206 [Kaiser Friedrich IV] as merchandise, he now seeks to crush the Emperor and free her. Meanwhile, http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli], an Alliance commander of similar calibre who really wanted to be a historian and not a soldier, wishes only for some peace and quiet; yet, as he unwillingly grows in relevance, he`ll see himself duty-bound to protect the Alliance`s democracy from the threat of the autocratic Empire. The collision of those two masters of tactics and strategy may bring the war to a close, provided, of course, that they aren`t first backstabbed by their respective countries` rotten internal politics... — written by Hinoe [i]Note: The original OVA release of mail-order VHS tapes were grouped into seasons as follows: Season 1: 01-26 (21.12.1988 to 20.06.1989) Season 2: 27-54 (21.06.1991 to 20.02.1992) Season 3: 55-86 (20.07.1994 to 16.01.1995) Season 4: 87-110 (??.09.1996 to 14.03.1997)[/i]

tag.name: meta tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ambitious
tag.description: having a strong desire for success or achievement; wanting power, money, etc.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: other planet
tag.description: The anime will fit this category if some or all of the action takes place on another planet which is supposedly in the same universe as Earth, not a complete fantasy world; usually there has to be some concept of space travel. The Latin name for Earth - Terra, would also pass the condition of being in the same universe as Earth. Basically, even mentioning of Earth existing or having existed would be enough. Although Moon is a moon, it also qualifies as Other Planet.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: sex
tag.description: Sexual intercourse, the ultimate bond of love and the "Origin of the World" (just think of Gustave Courbet`s painting).

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Physical force against self or other, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt.

tag.name: board games
tag.description: People here play a board game. It can vary from chess and Go, to Monopoly, to Dungeons and Dragons.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: Note that novel means book with words in paper, so no comics and no "visual novels", which should go under manga and dating-sim - visual Novel/erotic game respectively. Note that it can be applied to novels as we know them but also the typical light novels for teens and young adults, which are common in Japan and aside from being short include a number of illustrations.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale natural or human-made situation that causes great loss of or threat to life, health, property, or environment in such a way that society or environment are affected substantially.

tag.name: conspiracy
tag.description: The conspiracy thriller (or paranoid thriller) is a sub-genre of the thriller which flourished in the 1970s in the US (and was echoed in other parts of the world) in the wake of a number of high-profile scandals and controversies (most notably Vietnam, the assassination of President Kennedy, Chappaquiddick and Watergate), and which exposed what many people regarded as the clandestine machinations and conspiracies beneath the orderly fabric of political life. The protagonists of conspiracy thrillers are often journalists or amateur investigators who find themselves (often inadvertently) pulling on a small thread which unravels a vast conspiracy that ultimately goes "all the way to the top".

tag.name: alcohol
tag.description: Alcohol (or more scientifically, ethanol), is one of the world`s oldest psychoactive substances. It is traditionally found in the form of a beverage such as beer, wine, or liquor, although in some contexts it can be inhaled to produce similar or intoxication, and some people prefer another way of consuming beverage-form alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are many and varied, due to production methods (fermentation or distillation), source materials (grains, fruits, vegetables, other plants), added substances such as flavorings, and many more ways of defining different forms of alcoholic beverages. Alcoholic beverages are divided into three general classes: beers, wines, and spirits. They are legally consumed in most countries, and over 100 countries have laws regulating their production, sale, and consumption. In particular, such laws specify the minimum age at which a person may legally buy or drink them. This minimum age varies between 16 and 25 years, depending upon the country and the type of drink. Most nations set it at 18 years of age.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: chess
tag.description: Chess is a game for two players. It is played on a square board, made of 64 smaller squares, with eight squares on each side. Each player starts with sixteen pieces (eight pawns, two each of knights, bishops, and rooks, and one king and queen). One player`s pieces are a light color, he is called "White", and the other player`s pieces are a dark color, he is called "Black".

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: space is an ocean
tag.description: The difference between space and ocean is marginal. In fact the two are completely interchangeable. Spacecraft are usually called ships and space forces use naval ranks. Movement in space is two-dimensional. There is friction. And not to forget space pirates are roaming through the galaxy and just so often you will encounter space whales. Some titles take this even a step further by actually displaying the space as a sort of gigantic liquid mass.

tag.name: strategy
tag.description: Instead of blindly running into a battle or trap, at least one of the protagonists devises a clever strategy to significantly improve the odds of victory.

tag.name: everybody dies
tag.description: Not necessarily everyone, but a good portion of the characters kick the bucket.

tag.name: nobility
tag.description: The nobility is a social class distinguished by high hereditary or honorary rank that possesses privileges, or eminence, and certain rights not granted to members of other classes in a society, such as Commoners. The privileges of the nobility often comprise substantial real advantages, including rights of access, that vary from country to country and era to era

tag.name: thought-provoking
tag.description: The usually relatively quiet way the story in this anime is being told, gives the viewer the chance to not only follow the story but also to think about it.

tag.name: coup d`etat
tag.description: A coup d`état (/ˌkuːdeɪˈtɑː/; French: blow of state; plural: coups d`état), also known as a coup, a putsch, or an overthrow, is the sudden and illegal seizure of a government, usually instigated by a small group of the existing state establishment to depose the established government and replace it with a new ruling body. A coup d`état is considered successful when the usurpers establish their dominance. If a coup fails, a civil war may ensue.

tag.name: dialogue driven
tag.description: A dialogue driven show has its story advanced by dialogue, with action being of much lower priority, and relies heavily on conversations between characters.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: gore
tag.description: A Splatter film or Gore film is a sub-genre of horror film that deliberately focuses on graphic portrayals of gore and graphic violence. These films, through the use of special effects and excessive blood and guts, tend to display an overt interest in the vulnerability of the human body and the theatricality of its mutilation. Due to their willingness to portray images society might consider shocking, splatter films share some ideological grounds with the transgressive art movement. The term "splatter cinema" was coined by George A. Romero to describe his film Dawn of the Dead, though Dawn of the Dead is generally considered by critics to have higher aspirations, such as social commentary, than to be simply exploitative for its own sake. [Source: wiki]

tag.name: rebellion
tag.description:
Rebellion, uprising, or insurrection is a refusal of obedience or order. It may, therefore, be seen as encompassing a range of behaviors aimed at destroying or taking over the position of an established authority such as a government, governor, president, political leader, financial institution, or person in charge. On the one hand the forms of behaviour can include non-violent methods such as the (overlapping but not quite identical) phenomena of civil disobedience, civil resistance and nonviolent resistance. On the other hand it may encompass violent campaigns. Those who participate in rebellions, especially if they are armed rebellions, are known as "rebels".
Source: Wiki

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator.

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: social commentary
tag.description:
Social commentary is the act of rebelling against an individual, or a group of people by rhetorical means. This is most often done with the idea of implementing or promoting change by informing the general populace about a given problem and appealing to people’s sense of justice. (Source: Wikipedia)
Since this is anime, usually, the mores of Japan and the Japanese society are scrutinised, but not restricted to that.

tag.name: war-zone realities
tag.description: War is hell. This tag is for when characters experience the hell of war... not just the exciting stuff blowing up part.

tag.name: narration
tag.description: The most common example is that of a voice, either that of one of the characters or entirely unrelated, that appears at the beginning of an episode to offer a summary or introduction, and at the end of an episode for closure or for a preview to hint upon what to expect next. Another use of narration comes in the form of a dominant voice belonging to one of the protagonists, intended only for the viewer and revealing the intimate thoughts to whom it belongs. This type of narration occurs frequently throughout the duration of the episode or movie.

tag.name: loyalty
tag.description: Loyalty is faithfulness or a devotion to a person, country, group, or cause.

tag.name: machiavellian intrigues
tag.description: Named after Niccolò di Bernardo dei Machiavelli (3 May 1469 - 21 June 1527). Machiavelli is considered one of the founders of modern political science, and was a philosopher and diplomat. He is famous for his political treatise `The Prince`, which is essentially a manual about the acquisition and maintenance of power, including the need for deceit and the application of armed force. It is the use of deceit from which the term `Machievellian` derives. This term generally applies to a person who uses deceit to manipulate others for their own amoral (and usually power hungry) ends. This anime contains at least one character whose intrigues drive the plot.

tag.name: massacre
tag.description: Mass murder.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: space opera
tag.description: Space opera is a sub-genre of fiction that emphasizes romantic adventures in space. Space opera generally involves large-scale conflicts between opponents with powerful abilities and technology. The genre will often be melodramatic, sometimes playing music that can be nothing short of awesome. Warfare and a battle of wits are usually less emphasized, preferring romance (with exceptions, e.g. Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu). Some space operas tend to be formulaic and sometimes even prosaic, often employing very simple devices and somewhat obvious strategies. An example of this would be the infamous laws of physics in the Macross universe, in which the main male lead will hardly ever get hit in battle.

tag.name: battle of wits
tag.description: There is some intellectual battle between the characters. They each might attempt to discern what the other knows and/or could be planning. Then, rather than simply relying on the use of raw power, try to deduce an effective strategy to foil their opponent(s). The battle of wits can be in the center of the intrigue or just a side story. Examples: Death Note, Code Geass

tag.name: predominantly adult cast
tag.description: This show features mostly adults. That means children and teenagers are relatively rare and unlikely to hold significance to the plot. That is a rare trait in anime, as most shows spin around children or teenagers.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Reinhard von Lohengramm
character.description: Reinhard was born into a poor noble family. He lived with his father and his older sister Annerose. His mother died when he was young so he knew very little about her. When Reinhard moved to a middle class suburban neighborhood, he met Siegfried Kircheis and they soon became inseparable friends. When his father sold Annerose to become Kaiser Friedrich IV`s concubine, Reinhard swore that he would overthrow the Goldenbaum dynasty to rescue his older sister. He left school to join the military academy and persuaded Kircheis to come along with him.

character.name: Siegfried Kircheis
character.description: Reinhard von Lohengramm`s childhood friend and ally, possessing comparable military and personal ability.

character.name: Paul von Oberstein
character.description: Minister of Military and Internal Affairs.

character.name: Hans Eduard Bergengrun
character.description: Assistant to both Siegfried Kircheis and Oskar von Reuental. Committed suicide following the defeat of Reuental`s rebellion and his death.

character.name: Hildegard von Mariendorf
character.description: Hildegard von Mariendorf is one of the principal characters in the series. She served as the New Galactic Fleet`s Chief Advisor, and later reigned with Reinhard von Lohengramm when she became his wife and Empress in U.C.801. She was remembered by history as the one who nurtured the Lohengramm Dynasty to maturity, after her husband has established it. Hildegard, usually referred to by the nickname Hilde, was born in Galactic year 777 into an undistinguished noble family of the the Goldenbaum dynasty, the sole daughter of the benevolent and just Count Franz von Mariendorf. From an early age, she was distinguished from the other girls of the aristocrat society by her independent ideas. Completely unconcerned, Hilde pursued her own interests in reading, politics and history. Her mother having died when Hilde was young, her open-minded father respected Hilde`s unique ideas and choices in life.

character.name: Franz von Mariendorf
character.description: Chief Minister of Internal Affairs.

character.name: Friedrich IV
character.description: The thirty-sixth Kaiser of the Goldenbaum dynasty.

character.name: Magdalena von Westpfahl
character.description: Baroness Magdalena von Westpfahl was a close friend of http://anidb.net/ch205 [Annerose von Grunewald].

character.name: Ulrich Kesler
character.description: Chief of the Military Police.

character.name: Erlache
character.description: Rear Admiral Erlache was directly under the command of http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] at the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte].

character.name: Erwin Josef II
character.description: The thirty-seventh Kaiser of the Goldenbaum dynasty.

character.name: Adalbert von Fahrenheit
character.description: An admiral, whose humble background mirrors that of Reinhard von Lohengramm, specialising in attack.

character.name: Ernst von Eisenach
character.description: Ernst von Eisenach was one of Kaiser Reinhard`s high admirals. Known as the "Silent Admiral" due to his taciturn nature, he preferred to gesture or signal with his hands whenever possible.

character.name: Wilhelm von Klopstock
character.description: Formerly a distinguished aristocrat, but subsequently shunned after taking the wrong side in a power struggle.

character.name: Cary Willock
character.description: Willock is a smuggler captain recruited by http://anidb.net/ch477 [Marinesk] to pilot the http://anidb.net/ch82028 [Beryoska] in http://anidb.net/ch269 [Boris Konev]`s absence.

character.name: Gunter Kissling
character.description: Chief of the Royal Guards.

character.name: Felix Mittermeyer
character.description: Child of Elfriede von Kohlrausch and Oskar von Reuental who was adopted by the Mittermeyers.

character.name: Mainhoff
character.description: Chief Cabinet Secretary to Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Bruno von Silverberche
character.description: Talented and ambitious Chief Minister of Civil Engineering, tasked with the responsibility of establishing Imperial Governmental facilities on Phezzan.

character.name: Karl Blakke
character.description: A former noble who gave up his rank and title and worked towards the reformation of the autocratic rule of the Goldenbaum dynasty. Later made Minister of Civil Affairs by Reinhard, in recognition of the same.

character.name: Bernheim
character.description: Secretary of Protocol in Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Seefeld-hakase
character.description: Minister of Education in Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Bruckdolf
character.description: Chief of Legal Affairs under Kaiser Reinhard von Lohengramm.

character.name: Osmeyer
character.description: Minister of Internal Affairs in Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Heydrich Lang
character.description: Vice Minister of Internal Affairs and Chief of the Internal Security Department.

character.name: Fusenegger
character.description: Adjutant to Kempf.

character.name: Marika von Feuerbach
character.description: Marries http://anidb.net/ch208 [Ulrich Kesler] two years after the events of the series.

character.name: Eugen
character.description: Chief of Staff to the Black Lancers.

character.name: Wurmelink
character.description: Chief of Staff to Wahlen`s fleet at the 2nd Battle of Rantemario.

character.name: Lorenz
character.description: Adjutant to Grillpalzer.

character.name: Tonio
character.description: Gunner aboard the Flagship Barbarossa.

character.name: Yang Wenli
character.description: Yang Wen-li, is one of two protagonists within the series, the other being Reinhard von Lohengramm. Both share similar roles within their respective nations as famous national heroes renowned for their military skill. Compared to Reinhard, Yang is much more humble and dislikes his popularity as being a burden, while Reinhard relishes his prestige and desires more. At the start of the series, Yang has gained some fame as the "Hero of El Facil" for his exploits in the evacuation of the planet before Imperial occupation, and gains much more fame to become a national hero by the end of the first season.

character.name: Olivier Poplin
character.description: Olivier Poplin was an Alliance Spartanian pilot. A flying ace with over 250 kills (which he estimated would put him in the all-time top 10), he moved up the ranks from flying officer when in http://anidb.net/ch740 [Vice Admiral Paeta]`s 2nd fleet through squadron leader, commanding one half of the Iserlohn stationed fleet`s Spartanians, to wing commander under http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wen-li]. Brash, hard-drinking, womanising and wise-cracking, he was the perfect foil to his good friend, the calm, nap-taking, crossword-puzzle-solving http://anidb.net/ch781 [Ivan Konev]. Together, the two of them were in charge of training fresh recruits to their squadrons. In this role, he mentored both http://anidb.net/ch1298 [Karin] and http://anidb.net/ch742 [Julian]. In keeping with his womanising and drinking, he flew with an ace of hearts insignia on his helmet and his Spartanian (No. 170), and his squadrons were named after a variety of liquors. He belied his brashness, though, by advocating teamwork and many-on-one tactics with his pilots, rather than urging them to individual glory.

character.name: Jean Robert Lap
character.description: Lt. Cmdr. Jean Robert Lapp was http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wen-li]`s friend from the days when they were classmates at the Officer Academy. He was held in high regard by Yang, who valued the fact that Lapp`s thoughts and methods differed from his own. He died in the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte] when his ship, the http://anidb.net/ch82367 [Pergamonn], was lost in combat. He was posthumously promoted two ranks to the rank of Captain. At the time of his death, he was engaged to http://anidb.net/ch761 [Jessica Edwards].

character.name: Paeta
character.description: Died in the Rugpool Prison political prisoner riots

character.name: Julian Mintz
character.description: Yang`s adopted son, he later served as commander of the Iselhorn Republic Military at the age of eighteen.

character.name: Thoma von Stockhausen
character.description: Commander of the Iserlohn Fortress garrison.

character.name: Hans Dietrich von Seeckt
character.description: Commander of the stationed fleet, Iserlohn Fortress.

character.name: Dwight Greenhill
character.description: Admiral Dwight Greenhill was a highly respected officer, who served as chief of staff to http://anidb.net/ch744 [Fleet Admiral Sidney Sitolet] and later to http://anidb.net/ch769 [Fleet Admiral Lazll Lobos] during the invasion of the Galactic Empire in SC 796. His daughter was http://anidb.net/ch749 [Frederica Greenhill]. He led the http://anidb.net/ch6225 [National Salvation Military Council] during the military coup d`etat on Heinessen.

character.name: Grand Bishop
character.description: Leader of the Terraism movement.

character.name: De Villier
character.description: Archbishop of the Terraism movement and responsible for carrying out many of its plans.

character.name: Ottofried IV
character.description: The thirty-third Kaiser of the Goldenbaum dynasty.

character.name: Richard von Goldenbaum
character.description: Eldest son of http://anidb.net/ch1469 [Ottofried V]. Executed on charges of treason following a plot instigated by his younger brother, http://anidb.net/ch760 [Clementz].

character.name: Clementz von Goldenbaum
character.description: Middle son of http://anidb.net/ch1469 [Ottofried V]. After the discovery of his plot against his elder brother http://anidb.net/ch759 [Richard], he attempted to flee to Alliance territory, but died in the attempt.

character.name: James Thorndike
character.description: James Thorndike was the Peace Party`s candidate in the Therneusen by-elections.

character.name: Cornelia Windsor
character.description: Cornelia Windsor was the Secretary of Transport on the Alliance High Council. After Yang succeeded in taking Iserlohn, she was one of those strongly in favour of invading the Empire, said invasion culminating in the disastrous Battle of Amritsar Starzone.

character.name: Konev
character.description: Vice Admiral Konev was the Operations Staff Officer for the Alliance`s invasion of the Galactic Empire in SC 798. No relation to either http://anidb.net/ch269 [Boris] or http://anidb.net/ch781 [Ivan] Konev.

character.name: Borainen
character.description: Rear Admiral Borainen was the Information Chief of Staff for the Alliance`s invasion of the Galactic Empire in SC 798.

character.name: Hoghwood
character.description: Commander of the 7th Fleet.

character.name: Appleton
character.description: Vice Admiral Appleton was the commander of the 8th Fleet. Went down with his flagship, the http://anidb.net/ch82270 [Krishna], at the Battle of Amritsar Starzone, in battle with http://anidb.net/ch191 [Bittenfeld]`s Black Lancers.

character.name: Al Salem
character.description: Vice Admiral al-Salem was the commander of the 9th Fleet. His flagship was the http://anidb.net/ch82272 [Palamedes].

character.name: Ulanfu
character.description: Vice Admiral Ulanfu was the commander of the 10th Fleet. Died when his ship, the http://anidb.net/ch82273 [Bang-goo], was blown up in battle with http://anidb.net/ch191 [Bittenfeld]`s Black Lancers near the planet Lugen, shortly before the decisive Battle of Amritsar Starzone. Encircled by the Lancers, he used his flagship as the rearguard in a breakout operation, managing to save about half of the 10th fleet.

character.name: Borodin
character.description: Vice Admiral Borodin was the commander of the 12th Fleet. He committed suicide after his fleet was practically annihilated by http://anidb.net/ch189 [Lutz] at the Borsorn System prior to the Battle of Amritsar Starzone.

character.name: Toda
character.description: Spartanian maintenance chief on the Hyperion.

character.name: Royal Sanford
character.description: Royal Sanford was the Chairman of the Alliance High Council.

character.name: Connally
character.description: Rear Admiral Connally was the vice-commander of the 12th fleet. When the 12th fleet was practically annihilated by http://anidb.net/ch189 [Lutz] at the Borsorn System prior to the Battle of Amritsar Starzone, he took command after http://anidb.net/ch778 [Borodin]`s suicide and surrendered to Lutz.

character.name: Chan
character.description: 10th fleet chief of staff to http://anidb.net/ch777 [Vice Admiral Ulanfu].

character.name: Franz Valleymunt
character.description: Ensign Franz Valleymunt served as part of the Alliance 7th fleet. He was trained as a botanist and an engineer in addition to his military service.

character.name: Steinhof
character.description: One of the three Space Admirals at the end of the Goldenbaum dynasty.

character.name: Luglanju
character.description: Commander of the 11th fleet and member of the National Salvation Military Council. Committed suicide following defeat to Yang Wen-li at the Battle of Starzone Doria.

character.name: Evans
character.description: One of the members of the National Salvation Military Council. In addition to being the spokesman, served as acting Chairman for the short duration of time between the death of Admiral Greenhill and the arrival of Yang`s fleet. Committed suicide before he could be apprehended.

character.name: Emil von Reckendorf
character.description: Adjutant to Oskar von Reuental.

character.name: Lao
character.description: Officer on http://anidb.net/ch741 [Dusty Attenborough]`s staff.

character.name: Gutensonne
character.description: Adjutant to Cornelius Lutz.

character.name: Sanders
character.description: Adjutant to Fahrenheit.

character.name: Eugen Richter
character.description: A former noble who gave up his rank and title and worked towards the reformation of the autocratic rule of the Goldenbaum dynasty. Later made Minister of Finance by Reinhard, in recognition of the same.

character.name: Oppenheimer
character.description: Arrested for attempted bribery after offering Reinhard von Lohengramm a gift of paintings for his cabinet appointment.

character.name: Degsby
character.description: Terraism agent on Phezzan subdued by Rupert Kesselink.

character.name: Henslow
character.description: Henslow was the Free Planet Alliance`s high commissioner to Phezzan. He was easily manipulated by Rubinsky into raising suspicion against Yang Wenli. During Phezzan`s occupation by the Imperial fleet, he proved to be indecisive and incapable of independent action, relying on Julian for his escape.

character.name: Henrique Martino Borges de Arantes e Oliveira
character.description: Died in the Rugpool Prison political prisoner riots

character.name: Fields
character.description: Navigation officer aboard the Ulysses.

character.name: Drewentz
character.description: Adjutant to Neithard Muller.

character.name: Olrau
character.description: Adjutant to Neithard Muller.

character.name: Lionel Mouton
character.description: Deputy commander of the 5th Fleet.

character.name: Pletweri
character.description: Phezzani commissioner on Heinessen, reponsible for lobbying and outright bribery.

character.name: Molt
character.description: Officer responsible for the security of Kaiser Erwin Josef II.

character.name: Bomel
character.description: Phezzani merchant and people smuggler.

character.name: Viola
character.description: Julian Mintz`s superior during his time on Phezzan.

character.name: Katherine I
character.description: The thirty-eight and final Kaiserine of the Goldenbaum dynasty. Briefly held the position despite being only 8 months old before being succeeded by Reinhard von Lohengramm.

character.name: Rudolf von Goldenbaum
character.description: Founder of the Galactic Empire.

character.name: D. Sinclair
character.description: Historian specialising in modern history.

character.name: E.A. Mackenzie
character.description: Historian specialising in ideological history.

character.name: Magdalena
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch1019 [Rudolf von Goldenbaum]`s mistress in his later years. She bore him his only male progeny, but the child was born with congenital defects, dealing a heavy blow to his ideas of genetic and racial purity. Because of this, all traces of the birth, down to the attending doctors and nurses, were erased from history.

character.name: Sigissmunt I
character.description: The second Kaiser of the Galactic Empire.

character.name: Ale Heinessen
character.description: Spiritual founder of the Free Planets Alliance.

character.name: Friedrich III
character.description: The twentieth Kaiser of the Galactic Empire at the time of the discovery of the Free Planets Alliance in SC 640.

character.name: Herbert
character.description: Unsuccessfully waged the first military campaign against the Free Planets Alliance.

character.name: Leopold Laap
character.description: First Landesherr of Phezzan.

character.name: Glaesar
character.description: Mittermeyer`s landing forces commander.

character.name: Ralf Carlsen
character.description: Commander of the 14th Fleet.

character.name: Sebastian von Musel
character.description: Following the death of his wife Claribel, he embarked on a path of drinking and depression, including the sale of his daughter Annerose to Kaiser Friedrich IV, for which his son Reinhard never forgave him.

character.name: Emil von Secla
character.description: His father was a surgeon of the cruise ship, killed in the Battle of Amlitzer. Recruited by Hildegard von Mariendorf as Reinhard von Lohengramm`s personal attendant.

character.name: Xaniel
character.description: Alliance officer serving under http://anidb.net/ch773 [Admiral Bucock]. Held the rank of Commodore during the First Battle of Rantemario, was promoted to Read Admiral by the time of the Battle of Starzone Marr-Adetta. His flagship is the http://anidb.net/ch82024 [Belenus].

character.name: Marinetti
character.description: Alliance officer serving under http://anidb.net/ch773 [Admiral Bucock]. Held the rank of Commodore during the First Battle of Rantemario, was promoted to Read Admiral by the time of the Battle of Starzone Marr-Adetta. His flagship is the http://anidb.net/ch82026 [Rustam].

character.name: Grobner
character.description: Chief of Staff for the Black Lancers.

character.name: Buxtehude
character.description: Adjutant to Fahrenheit.

character.name: Dirxen
character.description: Adjutant to Bittenfeld.

character.name: Neissebach
character.description: Adjutant to Steinmetz.

character.name: Aubry Cockrane
character.description: Commander of the Alliance Laguna Supply Base.

character.name: Winslow Kennes Townshent
character.description: Accountant and secretary of a labour union, Fired on by a drunken Earth forces soldier, framed for the murder of his mother and subsequently became a fugitive. Logistics for the Black Flag Force.

character.name: Carle Palmgren
character.description: Reporter attacked by the Earth forces. Leader of the Black Flag Force and first leader of the Sirius Government.

character.name: Joliot Frankul
character.description: Studied botany at school, but became a fugitive when he beat an Earth soldier to death. Field Commander of the Black Flag Force.

character.name: Chao Yuilung
character.description: Studied composition at a music academy. Parents were killed by the Earth forces.

character.name: Werner
character.description: Adjutant to Ulrich Kesler.

character.name: Laft
character.description: Responsible for the suppression of Terraists during the Kunmel incident.

character.name: Elfriede von Kohlrausch
character.description: Last remaining heir to the Lichtenlade family.

character.name: Godwin
character.description: Terraism agent on Odin. Responsible for planning the failed assassination attempt on Reinhard von Lohengramm. Captured and committed suicide in custody.

character.name: Richard I
character.description: The third Kaiser of the Goldenbaum Dynasty.

character.name: Ottofried I
character.description: The fourth Kaiser of the Goldenbaum Dynasty. He despised change above all else, living to a very rigid schedule.

character.name: Eckhart
character.description: Imperial Secretary of State, ran the government during the rule of Ottofried I. Failed in assassination attempt on his successor Kaspar I after being rebuffed for the marriage of his daughter.

character.name: Kaspar I
character.description: The fifth Kaiser, and homosexual much to the embarrassment of Rudolf von Goldenbaum.

character.name: Julius I
character.description: The sixth Kaiser of the Goldenbaum Dynasty. Poisoned in a plot by his grandson following his prolonged rule and refusal to abdicate.

character.name: Karl
character.description: Former heir ousted from the royal family following discovery of his guilt in the assassination of Julius I.

character.name: Sigissmunt II
character.description: 7th Kaiser of the Goldenbaum dynasty. Succeeded to the throne following the expulsion of Karl, his cousin.

character.name: Wenzel von Hasselback
character.description: Grand Chamberlain to Reinhard von Lohengramm.

character.name: Ratzel
character.description: Responsible for surveillance of Yang Wen-li`s movements on Heinessen.

character.name: Kleiber
character.description: Adjutant to Samuel Wahlen.

character.name: Leiwul
character.description: Adjutant to Samuel Wahlen.

character.name: Hauff
character.description: Adjutant to Wahlen.

character.name: Gluck
character.description: Vice Minister of Civil Engineering.

character.name: Wagenseil
character.description: Admiral Wagenseil`s fleet was to form part of the middle section of Kaiser Reinhard`s fleet deployment in http://anidb.net/e12097 [Operation Ragnarok II], along with the http://anidb.net/ch1358 [Grotewohl], http://anidb.net/ch1359 [Meivoher] and http://anidb.net/ch1360 [Kurlich] fleets. He was later thoroughly outwitted by Julian in a http://anidb.net/e12129 [skirmish] on the Imperial end of the Iserlohn Corridor

character.name: Grotewohl
character.description: Admiral Grotewohl`s fleet was to form part of the middle section of Kaiser Reinhard`s fleet deployment in http://anidb.net/e12097 [Operation Ragnarok II], along with the http://anidb.net/ch1357 [Wagenseil], http://anidb.net/ch1359 [Meivoher] and http://anidb.net/ch1360 [Kurlich] fleets.

character.name: Meivoher
character.description: Vice Admiral Meivoher`s fleet was to form part of the middle section of Kaiser Reinhard`s fleet deployment in http://anidb.net/e12097 [Operation Ragnarok II], along with the http://anidb.net/ch1358 [Grotewohl], http://anidb.net/ch1357 [Wagenseil] and http://anidb.net/ch1360 [Kurlich] fleets.

character.name: Kurlich
character.description: Vice Admiral Kurlich`s fleet was to form part of the middle section of Kaiser Reinhard`s fleet deployment in http://anidb.net/e12097 [Operation Ragnarok II], along with the http://anidb.net/ch1358 [Grotewohl], http://anidb.net/ch1357 [Wagenseil] and http://anidb.net/ch1359 [Meivoher] fleets.

character.name: Baunsgaard
character.description: Engineering Vice-Admiral of the Planet Losiana ship construction facility.

character.name: Siegbert Seidlitz
character.description: Captain of the Brünhild.

character.name: Otto Wahler
character.description: Committed suicide following the loss of control of Iserlohn Fortress to the Alliance forces.

character.name: Claude Montaigne
character.description: Director of Finance and Treasury Board Secretariat.

character.name: Brentahno
character.description: Deputy military police commissioner, responsible for the suppression of the PKC.

character.name: Server
character.description: Adjutant to Steinmetz.

character.name: Bolenz
character.description: Chief of Staff to Steinmetz.

character.name: Ritschl
character.description: Formerly the Fleet Secretary of Steinmetz`s fleet when it was based out of the Gandharva system. Due to his knowledge of the affairs of former Alliance territories, he was later appointed Vice Inspector General of Neue Lande, under Reuenthal.

character.name: Julius Elsheimer
character.description: Civil Affairs Minister in Neue Land and husband to Cornelius Lutz`s sister. Refused to participate in the Reuental rebellion during which he was placed under house arrest.

character.name: Jurgens
character.description: Deputy chief of the royal guards.

character.name: Alfred Alois Winckler
character.description: Urvasi Base Commander, in charge of 500,000 men. Later discovered to be suffering from drug addiction.

character.name: Vonk
character.description: Vice Admiral Vonk was adjutant to http://anidb.net/ch1357 [Admiral Wagenseil].

character.name: Griess
character.description: Adjutant to Ernst von Eisenach.

character.name: Matt Hefer
character.description: Navigator aboard the Brunhild.

character.name: Kurt Zingufuber
character.description: Brünhild crew member. Dealt the fatal blow to Walter von Schenkopf.

character.name: Pegnitz
character.description: Count having family ties to the former Kiaser Ludwig III, and grandfather to Kaiserine Katherine I. Has an expensive taste for ivory.

character.name: Moore
character.description: Vice Admiral Moore was the commander of the 6th Fleet. He was killed in the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte] when his flagship, the http://anidb.net/ch82367 [Pergamonn], was lost in combat.

character.name: Pastoll
character.description: Vice Admiral Pastolle was the commander of the 4th Fleet. He was killed in the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte] when his flagship, the http://anidb.net/ch82368 [Leonidas], was lost in combat.

character.name: Ottofried V
character.description: The thirty-fifth Kaiser of the Goldenbaum dynasty.

character.name: Beiowulf
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch193 [Mittermeyer]`s flagship.

character.name: Ginga Teikoku
character.description: In the http://anidb.net/a584 [Legend of Galactic Heroes] universe, the Galactic Empire, also known as the Empire, is a nation with a feudalistic system and an aristocratic government based on the planet Odin, forged by http://anidb.net/ch1019 [Rudolf von Goldenbaum] and ruled with an iron fist by the Goldenbaum Dynasty and its nobles for centuries. The Empire was originally forged as its precursor, the Galactic Federation, decayed and its people looked for a hero-like politician to guide them; Rudolf, who was a very charismatic leader, fit the bill perfectly, and was also very power-hungry; he jumped at the opportunity, took all power into his hands, dissolved the Federation into a new Empire, and named himself the Kaiser. Eventually, refugees under the leadership of http://anidb.net/ch1026 [Ale Heinessen] would flee the oppression and form what became known as the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance], but the Alliance was discovered and attacked as rebels, and subsequently waged a seemingly endless war to a stalemate. As one might expect, nobles can be either born with that status or granted it, and that one of the lead characters would be made into a noble is a key plot point in the story. After almost 160 years of war and many centuries of bad government, http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] would take advantage of his military prowess to garner allies and power, even more so during the civil war that followed the death of http://anidb.net/ch206 [Kaiser Friedrich IV]. Soon afterwards, Reinhard would use that power in his favor to depose the Goldenbaum dynasty entirely, seizing power to himself and thus founding the Lohengramm Dynasty, also referred to as the New Galactic Empire. Under Reinhard`s leadership, the Empire would undergo drastic reforms; he revoked the privileges of nobles, seized control of the then-autonomous planet http://anidb.net/ch6233 [Phezzan], moved the government to it, started a new calendar, and did many other things that caused the horror of the former aristocracy, causing many nobles to unsuccessfully try to stop him. He soon also conquered the Alliance and imposed a harsh peace treaty, and after a revolt also annexed it altogether. After his death, his wife http://anidb.net/ch199 [Hildegard von Mariendorf] would lead the Galactic Empire into maturity, eventually changing it into a constitutional monarchy, as his highly respected, long-time rival, Alliance admiral http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wen-li] would have argued for.

character.name: Jiyuu Wakusei Doumei
character.description: In the http://anidb.net/a584 [Legend of Galactic Heroes] universe, the Free Planets Alliance, also known as the Alliance or the FPA, is a nation with a democratic government based on the planet Heinessen. During its history, it eventually grew to occupy the Sagittarius Arm of the Milky Way galaxy, and became one of the two centres of human civilization in the galaxy. It was founded by refugees who fled the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire] under the leadership of http://anidb.net/ch1026 [Ale Heinessen], but was discovered and attacked, and subsequently waged a seemingly endless war to a stalemate. For several reasons, after almost 160 years of war, the military situation in the Alliance rapidly deteriorated in comparison to the Empire and the war stalemate soon became a massive one-sided victory. The peace treaty imposed by http://anidb.net/ch186 [the Emperor] was very harsh, and the Imperial interference soon led to uprising, which was then used by the Emperor to again declare war. This new war would end in only a few months and lead to the complete dissolution of the Alliance.

character.name: Reinhard von Musel
character.description: Reinhard was born into a poor noble family. He lived with his father and his older sister Annerose. His mother died when he was young so he knew very little about her. When Reinhard moved to a middle class suburban neighborhood, he met Siegfried Kircheis and they soon became inseparable friends. When his father sold Annerose to become Kaiser Friedrich IV`s concubine, Reinhard swore that he would overthrow the Goldenbaum dynasty to rescue his older sister. He left school to join the military academy and persuaded Kircheis to come along with him.

character.name: Ostmark
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch303 [Marquis Littenheim]`s flagship. Same class as the http://anidb.net/ch82215 [Berlin] and the http://anidb.net/ch82216 [Wilhelmina], equipped with a pair of shield ships, similar to the Berlin.

character.name: Vonkel
character.description:
The Vonkel was http://anidb.net/ch237 [High Admiral Karl Robert Steinmetz]`s flagship.
At the Battle of the Iserlohn Corridor, it was sunk with all hands but one in action against http://anidb.net/ch791 [Marino]`s assault force, the only survivor being Admiral Markgraf, who reported the passing of his commander.

character.name: Geiersberg Yousai
character.description: An artificial sphere 45km in diameter and weighing 40 trillion tonnes, Geiersberg (Vulture`s Castle) was an Imperial fortress in the same class as http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn], though smaller in magnitude. Its primary armament, the Geiers Haken (ガイエスハーケン, Vulture`s Claw) was an X-ray beam cannon with a wavelength of 100 angstroms and a total power output of 740,000,000 MW, comparable to Iserlohn`s Thor Hammer. Its hangars could berth a fleet of 16,000 ships. The surface was composed of alloys, ceramic and hydro-metal. Due to the gradual sublimation of some of the fluid metal over the course of the years since its construction, the surface had acquired a skeletal appearance, with various "pools" or "lakes" of fluid metal. One of these was thought to resemble a vulture, leading to the fortress acquiring its fanciful name. It was used by the high nobles as their headquarters during the Lippstadt Rebellion. It was later augmented with 12 warp engines, as per http://anidb.net/ch218 [Admiral Schaft]`s plan, allowing it to warp into the Iserlohn Corridor and mount an assault on Iserlohn. For this operation, it was placed under the command of http://anidb.net/ch190 [Admiral Kempf].

character.name: Kucrain
character.description: Droisen fleet flagship.

character.name: Vissarr
character.description: Eisenach fleet flagship.

character.name: Kvasir
character.description: Flagship of Mecklinger`s Fleet.

character.name: Jotunheim
character.description: Flagship of Kempf`s fleet.

character.name: Theodoricus
character.description: The Theodoricus was http://anidb.net/ch1035 [Vice Admiral Isaak Fernand von Thurneysen]`s flagship.

character.name: Forseti
character.description: Flagship of http://anidb.net/ch208 [Kesler]`s fleet. The lead ship of the Forseti-class, the other ships in the class being the http://anidb.net/ch1755 [Skirnir] and the http://anidb.net/ch1490 [Salamander]. Forseti was a god of justice and reconciliation in the Norse pantheon.

character.name: Rosen Ritter
character.description: The Rosen Ritter was an infantry assault regiment composed entirely of Imperial deserters, refugees, exiles and their children. While unmatched in their combat capability, a question mark always hung over where their true allegiance lay -- a valid question, given that six of their twelve previous commanders had deserted back to the Empire.

character.name: Saikou Hyougikai
character.description: The 11-member High Council was the highest governing body of the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance].

character.name: Undutiness
character.description: After the destruction of the http://anidb.net/ch82028 [Beryoska], http://anidb.net/ch269 [Boris Konev] was left without a ship. In the confusion of the events following the Battle of Vermilion, http://anidb.net/ch745 [Alex Cazellnu] arranged for a brand-new Alliance vessel to be listed as decommissioned, while actually being given to Boris. Christened the "Undutiness" at http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang]`s suggestion, this was the vessel used by http://anidb.net/ch742 [Julian] on his trip to Earth -- the name being Yang`s joke, as Julian was effectively neglecting his duties towards his "parent". The same vessel was used by Boris to bring information to http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn] about the plot on Yang`s life, and the news of http://anidb.net/ch194 [Reuenthal]`s rebellion

character.name: Airget Lamh
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch751 [Admiral Edwin Fischer]`s flagship. Pennant number BG-20.

character.name: Belenus
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch1065 [Commodore (later Rear Admiral) Xaniel]`s flagship at the First Battle of Rantemario. Pennant number 609R. Named after a Celtic sun god.

character.name: Rustam
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch1066 [Commodore (later Read Admiral) Marinetti]`s flagship during the First Battle of Rantemario. Pennant number 205N. Named after Rustam, the hero of the Persian epic, Shahnameh.

character.name: Ulysses
character.description: The Ulysses was an Alliance battleship endowed with the contrasting attributes of being lucky (since it tended to survive battles with little damage) while at the same time drawing enemy attention (often being the first ship to come into contact with an enemy fleet). Served as http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli]`s flagship after http://anidb.net/ch202 [Admiral Merkatz] took command of the http://anidb.net/ch82015 [Hyperion]. Pennant number 913-D.

character.name: Klapf
character.description: Brigadier general in Mittermeyer`s fleet. Responsible for securing Phezzan`s Space Navigation Bureau during the occupation of Phezzan.

character.name: Diomedes
character.description: 15th fleet flagship, under the command of http://anidb.net/ch1038 [Vice Admiral Ralf Carlsen]. Destroyed with all hands at the Battle of Marr-Adetta.

character.name: Reinhard (Younen)
character.description: Reinhard von Musel (later von Lohengramm) as a child.

character.name: Strauss
character.description: Admiral Strauss was the Fleet Chief of Staff of Mecklinger`s fleet.

character.name: Masasoite
character.description: The Masasoite was http://anidb.net/ch741 [Dusty Attenborough]`s flagship during the http://anidb.net/e12136 [Battle] of the http://anidb.net/e12150 [Iserlohn] http://anidb.net/e12144 [Corridor] and the Battle of Shiva Starzone. Pennant number 115I.

character.name: Shigyaku Misuihan
character.description: Soldier who attempts to assassinate Kaiser Reinhard at the Phezzan War Cemetery as vengeance for his family that perished in the thermonuclear bombing of Westerland during the Lippstadt Rebellion. The Westerland incident was particularly sensitive for Reinhard, given that he had failed to prevent the attack despite knowing of it, and was later taken to task by Siegfried Kircheis for this sin of omission. Thrown into emotional turmoil by the assassins taunting and cutting barbs, he seeks comfort in Hilda`s arms and ends up sleeping with her. This in turn leads to his marriage proposal to her and the eventual birth of Alexander.

character.name: Kempf no Chounan
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch190 [Admiral Kempf]`s elder son.

character.name: Marduk
character.description: Sandor Alarcon`s flagship. Pennant number 813C.

character.name: Maurya
character.description: Nguyen Van Thieu`s flagship. Originally painted similar to other Alliance ships, later converted to the tiger-stripe livery. Pennant number E-5.

character.name: Lang Fujin
character.description: Heydrich Lang`s wife.

character.name: Sims
character.description: Sergeant charged with guarding Yang during the course of the secret inquiry chaired by Negroponty.

character.name: Yuukoku Kishidan Danchou
character.description: Leader of a gang of Patriotic Knight Corps (PKC) thugs. Attempts an attack on Frederica Greenhill when she seeks out http://anidb.net/ch773 [Admiral Bucock]`s help during the course of the inquiry chaired by http://anidb.net/ch858 [Negroponty]. His attack is foiled by http://anidb.net/ch820 [Mashengo] and by the appearance of Bucock`s staff, including http://anidb.net/ch797 [Pfeiffel].

character.name: Mittermeyer no Haha
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer]`s mother.

character.name: Mittermeyer no Chichi
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer]`s father.

character.name: Rauditz
character.description: Lieutenant Colonel of the Wessel sniper battalion serving under http://anidb.net/ch303 [Marquis Littenheim]. Kills the Marquis in a suicide attack at the Garmisch Fortress, leading eventually to the defeat of the Littenheim force and the loss of Garmisch.

character.name: Berlin
character.description: Prince Braunschweig`s flagship. Equipped with a pair of shield ships, one on each side, similar to the http://anidb.net/ch1754 [Ostmark], the Berlin having the flashier.

character.name: Garmisch Yousai
character.description: Imperial fortress. Used by http://anidb.net/ch303 [Marquis Littenheim] as his headquarters and staging point during the Lippstadt Rebellion. Consisted of 5 large interconnected spherical units. Unlike Iserlohn or Geiersberg, Garmisch does not appear to possess any large offensive weapon, but holds a significantly larger fleet (at least 50,000, the strength of Littenheim`s fleet).

character.name: Leonidas II
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch800 [Vice Admiral Legrange]`s flagship. Destroyed at the Battle of Starzone Doria. Pennant number 11. Named after the Spartan king who fell at the Battle of Thermopylae, this was the second ship to carry the name, following the http://anidb.net/ch82368 [4th fleet flagship] that was lost at the Battle of Astarte.

character.name: Whitty
character.description: Aide-de-campe to http://anidb.net/ch1410 [Admiral Kubersly].

character.name: Krishna
character.description: 8th fleet flagship commanded by http://anidb.net/ch775 [Vice Admiral Appleton]. Pennant number 08 01. Went down with Vice Admiral Appleton at the Battle of Amritsar Starzone, when a hit to the engine room rendered it impossible for it to maintain orbit around the star Amritsar.

character.name: Cu Chulainn
character.description: 3rd fleet flagship under the command of http://anidb.net/ch772 [Vice Admiral Lefebvre]. Pennant number 03 01. Lost in battle with http://anidb.net/ch188 [Wahlen]`s fleet near the planet Lesing.

character.name: Palamedes
character.description: 9th fleet flagship under the command of http://anidb.net/ch776 [Vice Admiral al-Salem]. Damaged in battle with http://anidb.net/ch193 [Mittermeyer]`s forces in the Alweis System shortly before the Battle of Amritsar Starzone. Pennant number 09 01.

character.name: Bang-goo
character.description: 10th fleet flagship commanded by http://anidb.net/ch777 [Vice Admiral Ulanfu]. Pennant number 10 01. Lost in battle with http://anidb.net/ch191 [Bittenfeld]`s Black Lancers at the planet Lugen.

character.name: Perun
character.description: Flagship of the 12th fleet under http://anidb.net/ch778 [Vice Admiral Borodin] and later http://anidb.net/ch784 [Rear Admiral Connally].

character.name: Montarque
character.description: Kleingelt family retainer.

character.name: Ein
character.description: Part of Iserlohn`s security detail.

character.name: Yuukoku Kishidan
character.description: The Patriotic Knight Corps (PKC) was a vigilante/terrorist organisation that "purged" any citizens that they deemed to be "treasonous". In reality, they were a private army owing allegiance to http://anidb.net/ch743 [Truniht] and his cronies such as http://anidb.net/ch762 [Togliatti], acting to intimidate, assault and even murder their political opponents. It is revealed later that there are deep connections between the Terraists and the PKC.

character.name: Josei Heishi
character.description: Serves in the Military Official News Bureau.

character.name: Patoroklos
character.description: 2nd fleet flagship under the command of http://anidb.net/ch740 [Vice Admiral Paeta]. Pennant number 02.

character.name: Pergamonn
character.description: 6th fleet flagship under the command of http://anidb.net/ch1411 [Vice Admiral Moore]. Destroyed in combat at the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte]. Pennant number 06.

character.name: Leonidas
character.description: 4th fleet flagship under the command of http://anidb.net/ch1412 [Vice Admiral Pastolle]. Destroyed in combat at the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte]. Pennant number 04. Named after the Spartan king who fell at the Battle of Thermopylae.
